Title.evidence: Title: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Supraclavicular and Retroclavicular Brachial Plexus Block on Diaphragmatic Function

Trial_Design.evidence: Forty patients scheduled for upper extremity surgery below the axilla were randomised

Participants.evidence: Exclusion criteria included significant pulmonary disease, BMI >40, and contraindications to peripheral nerve block.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either SCB or RCB with ropivacaine 0.5%

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of phrenic block, measured by changes in diaphragmatic excursion and maximum inspiratory volume at baseline, 15, 30 minutes postblock, and postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation concealment was achieved using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for patients and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 40 patients were randomised, with 20 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 40 patients were randomised, with 20 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The SCB group exhibited a higher incidence of phrenic block (70% by ultrasound, 55% by spirometry) compared to the RCB group (15% by ultrasound, 5% by spirometry).
